subject: Programming
title: The Zone and Flow State
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Zone and Flow State.

hook.text: You've been coding for hours but it feels like minutes. Time disappeared. You were in the zone.

buildup.text: Psychologist Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi called this 'flow' â€” deep focus where skill meets challenge.

discovery.text: Flow requires a task that's neither too easy (boring) nor too hard (frustrating). The sweet spot.

twist.text: One interruption destroys flow. It takes 15-25 minutes to re-enter, and it may not come back at all.

climax.text: Protecting flow time is protecting productivity. The best teams guard uninterrupted blocks fiercely.

punchline.text: Flow is fragile. Protect it like gold.

quiz.question: How long does it take to re-enter flow after an interruption?
